articles.author: Mark DeCambre
articles.title: Oil set for 4th straight gain as investors watch Iranian sanctions
articles.description: Oil futures on Tuesday flirt with a fourth straight gain as investors watched U.S. sanctions against Iran for the potential to disrupt global supplies.

articles.title: Toll Brothers shares surge after lifting its revenue forecast on robust demand for luxury homes

articles.author: William Schomberg
articles.title: UK budget surplus in July eases headache for Hammond
articles.description: Britain reported its biggest budget surplus for the month of July in 18 years on Tuesday, giving finance minister Philip Hammond some extra room for manoeuvre as he faces pressure to relax his grip on spending later this year.

articles.title: Animal crackers' animals "freed" as boxes get new look

articles.title: The dollar is falling after Trump slammed the Fed again
articles.description: One analyst said a pattern is starting to emerge showing "the president willing to talk the USD lower whenever it starts to look a bit toppy."

articles.author: Georgi Kantchev
articles.title: Global Stocks Steady but Dollar Weakens After President Trump's Fed Remarks
articles.description: U.S. stocks were set to open higher and the dollar fell, as investors parsed the latest signals in the trade spat between the U.S. and China and President Trump’s comments about the Federal Reserve.

articles.title: Jon Stewart Finds a Home for Brooklyn's Lost Subway Goats
articles.description: The comedian picked up the goats that had trotted into the N train line tracks with plans to relocate them to a farm in Watkins Glen, N.Y., a spokeswoman said.

articles.author: Eric M. Johnson
articles.title: Paul Allen's space firm details plans for rockets, cargo vehicle
articles.description: The space company of billionaire Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen on Monday unveiled details of medium-lift rockets and a reusable space cargo plane it is developing, injecting more competition into the lucrative launch services market.

articles.title: Party animal venture capitalist Rothenberg accused by SEC of bilking investors
articles.description: Venture capitalist Mike Rothenberg was charged by the SEC with overcharging investors and using the money for his own adventures.

articles.title: Alpaca dies after eating Doritos, Cheese Nips and peanuts
articles.description: A community alpaca in Florida has died after someone repeatedly fed the animal Doritos, Cheese Nips, and peanuts, according to officials at Creekside Animal Hospital.

articles.author: Dominique Mosbergen
articles.title: Here's Why You Should Never Flush Your Contact Lenses Down The Toilet
articles.description: Researchers estimate that billions of lenses are flushed each year in the U.S. -- and fragments of them might be ending up in our oceans.
